result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Petition for Payment of Legal Fees with proposed order
Criminal case settlement

Cases #13CF419, #13CF465,#14CF61,#14CF131,#14CF219 called at 10:10am. [MK] 
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered in Case #13CF465; factual basis stipulated including as to the prior Possession of THC conviction; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Teuber submits the victim impact statement in case #13CF419) ; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Herrick guilty in Case #13CF465, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF61, and the Court dismisses case #13CF419 outright. 

In Case #13CF465 the Court sentences Mr. Herrick to:
--serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on December 26, 2014 at 7:00pm
, consecutive to any sentences in being 
--0 days credit for time already served given
 (counsel are  to submit a written stipulation on days credit by January 2nd) 
--Mr. Herrick is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to comply with DNA sample provision upons request 
--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518, plus $25 drug testing fee, plus $33 summons fee in this case and plus $33 summons fee in read-in case #14CF61, plus court-appointed attorney fees; this total amount is to be paid through application of the $2500 cash bail [which currently also applies to pending cases].
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
As to Case #13CF365, the Court continues the bond and its conditions until the jail term commences.

The Court and counsel discuss scheduling in Cases #14CF131 and #14CF219. The Court intends to re-call case #14CF219 at the scheduling hearing time of 11:00am.
recess 10:36am.
reconvene at 11:06am. as to Case #14CF219 only:  ADA Teuber and Attorney Laitsch appear (Mr. Herrick's appearance at this time has been excused).
Counsel confirm that the case is not resolved. 
ADA Teuber recommends that a two day trial length be scheduled. 
The Court indicates that it will schedule the trial sixty days out so that the parties have ample time to prepare and subpoena witnesses. 
recess 11:08am. 

NEXT:  
--in Case #14CF131:  (1) Plea/Sentencing on 12/3/14 at 8:00am (2) Jury Trial remains on the calendar for 12/4-12/5/14 at 8:30am. 
--in Case #14CF219: the case is referred to Branch III for scheduling of FSSC and a two-day Jury Trial in approximately sixty days
Petition for Attorney Fees granted to Attorney Laitsch in the amount of $553.

Cases 14CF61 & 14CF131 called together at 1:52 pm
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney Charles B Penwell. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES:

Pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty Penwell informs the Court that they are not requesting speedy trial

Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Herrick

cases #14CF61 & #14CF131 called briefly at 3:58pm, and then again at 4:15pm. 
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney C. Bennett Penwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary Hearing is conducted first in Case #14CF131:
Officer Jeff Hottman- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Penwell
Officer Ryan Enger- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Penwell
ADA Hall submits State's Exhibit #1:  print-outs
 of CCAP records for cases 14CF61,13CF465,and 13CF419- received as to both cases #14CF131 & #14CF61.
Closing arguments given by Attorney Penwell

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Herrick committed a felony in case #14CF131. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Preliminary Hearing is conducted next in Case #14CF61:
Officer Ryan Enger- resumes stand, still under oath
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Penwell
ADA Hall submits State's Exhibit #2:  certified copies of the bonds in cases 14CF61,13CF465,and 13CF419- received as to both cases #14CF131 & #14CF61.
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Herrick committed a felony in Case #14CF61. The Court binds him over for Trial.
Attorney Penwell verifies that Mr. Herrick's 9 S. Water Street  W.,Apt 4 remains current. 
recess 4:59pm. 

NEXT: schedule both cases for Arraignment within thirty days
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2014 at 03:45 pm.

Cases #13CF419,#13CF465.#14CF61 and #14CF131 called at 10:32am
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney C. Bennett Penwell. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

INITIAL APPEARANCE CONDUCTED IN CASE #14CF131:
--On request of Mr. Herrick, the Court appoints Attorney Penwell as defense counsel.
--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.

Counsel indicate that the State has withdrawn the plea agreement that had been reached in cases #13CF419,#13CF465 and #14CF61. 
Arguments given on bond. DA Happ requests that cash bond be set in the new case
The Court continues the bonds in cases #13CF419 and #14CF61.
On the Court's own motion, the Court requires a $2,500 Cash Bond that applies to both cases #13CF465 and #14CF131 with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 
10:51am.

NEXT:  (1) schedule cases #14CF131 and #14CF61 for Preliminary Hearing on 4/21/14 at 3:45am-- ten day time limit pends in the #14CF131 case  (2) schedule cases #13CF419 and #13CF465 for FSSC and separate one day length Jury Trial dates--schedule case #13CF419 first in time
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.

If Court agrees - parties would like matter set for additional STC in 2 weeks - agreement should be reached then

Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Herrick and informs parties that will set for plea

cases #13CF419, #13CF465, #14CF61 called at 8:43am. 
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney C Bennett Penwell.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case #14CF61:  
--after Mr. Herrick verifies that his financial status remains the same as when the Court previously appointed counsel, and at the request of Mr. Herrick, the Court appoints Attorney Penwell in this case
--counsel confirm the waiver of Preliminary Hearing time limits 

As to Case #13CF465:  Arraignment is conducted:
--service of the Information is admitted; reading is waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Copy of conflict review worksheet from 13CF419

Case called at 1:42 pm
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews conflict review worksheet. Court finds that there is no conflict.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the defendant's eligibility for SPD representation will depend on bond.
Court reviews criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Ms.Henze

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Court will defer the issue of appointment of Attorney Penwell to Judge Weston.
Court will also defer the issue of Preliminary Time limits to be determined at the 2/17/14 hearing.

Recess: 1:50 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Status: 2/17/14 at 8:30 am (Court sets with def's other cases 13CF419 & 13CF465)
